That is something that I have not done since - I have never fallen asleep at a real movie, like going to the theater and watching the move.  I would watch a John Wayne or Ben Hur with approximately no interruptions on syndication channel on TV where I could fast forward through places when they go for ten minutes straight talking about winds blowing then showing someone in a boat with the hate face.

While credited as a Tom and Jerry cartoon, this is not the cat-and-mouse team but an earlier Mutt-and-Jeff rip-off featuring them going about to survive in today's turbulent economy. In the end, they channel their problems over into other people's families and homes during busy party moments. Their schemes can be callous but funny along with a twist ending.

Snow White is in my opinion a bad movie on an artistic point of view. The plot is pretty much foreseeable, the characters are stereotypes, the editing too. The movie was decent produced though.
That being said, as a piece of film history it's mostly important to see how far we've come and how this single Brother's Grimm story turned into a prismatic source for fairy tale cinema.<|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|>

Michael Dudikoff stars as Joe Armstrong a martial artist who fights ninjas who are stealing weapons from the U.S Army, in this entertaining yet admittedly brainless comedic action film. This film is going to have you laughing like an idiot throughout its short 89 Min duration, due to its low budget and very poor CGI work.
